buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Install additional monitoring systems for water treatment equipment
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: The current design includes dual UV disinfection systems but would benefit from real-time monitoring to ensure continuous operation and immediate notification of any issues.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Increased reliability of water treatment system and reduced risk of water quality issues.
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Add water quality monitoring system with remote notification capabilities to alert maintenance staff of any issues.

buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Implement advanced controls for rooftop units
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: The specified HVAC equipment supports advanced controls that could optimize performance beyond the base requirements.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Potential energy savings of 10-15% through optimized operation and enhanced economizer control.
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Upgrade control sequences to include demand-controlled ventilation and integration with building automation system.

buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Standard roof curbs may create thermal bridging that can reduce overall system efficiency.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Reduction in energy loss and potential condensation issues.
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Specify higher R-value insulation for rooftop equipment curbs beyond minimum requirements.

buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Complex HVAC and water treatment systems require thorough commissioning to ensure proper operation.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Verification of proper system operation and documentation for future maintenance.
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Develop detailed commissioning plan including testing of all control sequences and system performance metrics.

buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Schedule early procurement of long-lead equipment
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Daikin RTUs have 10-20 week lead times which could impact project schedule if not ordered early.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Avoidance of potential project delays of 4-8 weeks.
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Early submittal and procurement process for Daikin RTUs and other long-lead items.

buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Verify ductless split system model compatibility
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Trane split system specifications show model numbers with Mitsubishi designations (MSZ/MUZ), indicating potential supply chain or specification issue.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Prevention of procurement delays and installation issues.
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Coordinate with design team to verify correct manufacturer and model specifications before procurement.

buildVisionRecommendations.recommendation: Ensure wind restraint submittals meet requirements
buildVisionRecommendations.rationale: Division 23 requires PE-stamped calculations and submittals for rooftop equipment curbs and supports.
buildVisionRecommendations.estimatedImpact: Compliance with code requirements and prevention of inspection issues.
buildVisionRecommendations.implementation: Coordinate with structural engineer for wind restraint design and certification of all rooftop equipment.
